title: Zimbabwe rejects 'lopsided' US health aid deal over data concerns
content: Access to biological samples raised flags for Zimbabwe as the US did not want to share the benefits of its research.

originalTitle: Bill Gates 'took responsibility' over Epstein ties in staff meeting, foundation says
title: Our Friend Bill Gates Says Sorry and Keeps Helping Africa!
content:
Hello, hello, amazing children of Africa! Your friendly news reporter is here with exciting and important news! I hope you are all having a wonderful day, learning new things and playing with your friends. Today, we're going to talk about a very special person named Mr. Bill Gates. Have you heard his name before? He is a super kind man who helps many, many people all around the world, especially right here in Africa! He loves helping kids like you grow up strong, healthy, and smart. Mr. Bill Gates does so much good for our continent. He helps schools get computers, helps doctors make people healthy, and helps families get clean water. He wants to make the world a much better place for everyone. Recently, something happened where Mr. Gates had to say 'sorry' to the people who work with him. Let's find out why, and what it means for all the amazing work he does for us.

Who is Bill Gates? Our Big Helper!

Imagine a superhero, but instead of wearing a cape, he uses his brain and his kind heart to help millions of people. That's a bit like Mr. Bill Gates! A long, long time ago, he helped create something called 'Microsoft.' It's a very big company that makes computers and the special programs inside them. You might even be using a computer that was helped by his ideas right now! But Mr. Gates didn't just want to make computers. He wanted to use his clever ideas and his money to help solve big problems in the world. So, he and his wife, Mrs. Melinda Gates, started a special team called the 'Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation.' This team works incredibly hard every day to make life better for everyone. They help bring medicines to faraway villages, make sure kids get good food to eat, and help teachers get books for schools. They are truly big friends of Africa! *Did you know?* Bill Gates is one of the richest people in the world, but he gives away billions of his money to help make the world fairer and healthier for everyone! That's a lot of helping!

Saying Sorry is Brave and Important

Sometimes, even grown-ups make mistakes, or they feel sad about something that happened. Recently, Mr. Bill Gates said 'sorry' to all the wonderful people who work with him at his foundation. Saying sorry is a very brave thing to do. It means you understand that something wasn't quite right, or you feel bad about how something turned out. Why did he say sorry? Well, Mr. Gates had met someone a few times, a long time ago, who turned out to be a very, very bad person. This person did things that were wrong and not kind. When Mr. Gates found out more about this person, he felt sad and disappointed. He wanted to tell his team that he was very, very sorry for ever having met this bad person. He made it very clear that he 'did nothing wrong' and 'saw nothing wrong' himself. This means he didn't know about the bad things this other person was doing when they met.

Who Was This Person? (Keeping it Simple and Safe)

It's sometimes hard to know if someone is a good person or not. We have to be careful about who we spend our time with, and who we trust. The person Mr. Gates met was called Mr. Epstein. He was not a good person, and he did many bad things. Mr. Gates wanted everyone to know that he felt very bad about having any connection at all to someone like that. He wanted to reassure his team that he only cares about doing good and helping people. It's a bit like if you accidentally played with someone who was mean to others, and then you found out they were doing really bad things. You would feel sad and want to say sorry for being near them, even if you didn't do anything mean yourself. That's how Mr. Gates felt.

Mr. Bill Gates' Helping Hands in Africa

Even with this sad news, Mr. Bill Gates and his team are still working harder than ever to help kids and families across Africa. Their hearts are truly with our continent. They know that every child deserves a chance to live a happy and healthy life, full of learning and laughter. Think about all the ways they help: * **Health Shields:** They help bring special medicines called vaccines to children. These vaccines are like tiny, invisible shields that protect your body from getting sick with diseases like measles or polio. * **Food for All:** They help farmers grow more food, even when the weather is difficult. This means more children can have enough to eat and grow up strong. * **Clean Water Heroes:** They help communities get clean, safe drinking water. Clean water stops many sicknesses and helps everyone stay healthy. * **Learning Lights:** They help schools get books, computers, and good teachers, so more children can learn to read, write, and dream big dreams. *Did you know?* The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation has given billions of dollars to help fight diseases like malaria and HIV/AIDS in Africa, saving millions of lives!

Working Together for a Brighter Future

Mr. Bill Gates truly believes in the children of Africa. He believes that with a little help, every child can grow up to be amazing and do wonderful things for their families and communities. The people who work with him at his foundation are also very dedicated. They wake up every day thinking about how they can make a positive difference. This whole story shows us something important: It's okay to say sorry. And even when difficult things happen, we can still choose to do good and keep helping others. Mr. Gates' promise to his team and to the world is that he will continue to focus on the important work of making our world healthier, fairer, and a happier place for everyone, especially for all of you, the bright stars of Africa.

Let's Remember to Be Kind

So, remember kids, always try to be kind, always try to help others, and it's okay to say sorry when you need to. And know that there are many good people like Mr. Bill Gates who are working hard to make your world a better place. Until next time, keep shining bright!
summary: Bill Gates, a kind man who helps many people in Africa, said sorry to his team for meeting someone who did bad things, but he promises to keep working hard to make the world better for kids.
whyMatters: This matters because it shows that even important people say sorry when they feel bad about something, and that helping others is still very important and good work continues.

originalTitle: Man Utd post profit but debt rises to £1.3bn
title: Man Utd post profit but debt rises to £1.3bn
content: The amount Manchester United owe increases to almost £1.3bn in outstanding transfer fees, rolling credit facility and legacy debt.

originalTitle: Uefa rejects Benfica appeal over Prestianni ban
title: Uefa rejects Benfica appeal over Prestianni ban
content: Gianluca Prestianni will miss the second leg of Benfica's Champions League tie against Real Madrid after Uefa reject the club's appeal against his suspension.

title: Terry 'frustrated' over Chelsea caretaker choice
content: Former Chelsea captain John Terry says he is "frustrated" at being overlooked for a caretaker role following Enzo Maresca's departure as head coach in January.
